Nina Millspaugh Diary, 1889, 1895-1898

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Diary of a Kansas City, Kansas, housewife. She gives the weather in most entries and an account of her chores and the day's events. Entries cover March-April 1889 and August 1895-September 1898.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Nina Millspaugh Diary must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Nina Millspaugh Diary, Ms1982-001, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Nina Millspaugh Diary was acquired by Special Collection prior to 1982.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Nina Millspaugh Diary was completed prior to 2010. Additional description was completed in November 2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The diary contains an almost daily account of the life of Nina Millspaugh. Nina Millspaugh was a housewife from Kansas City, Kansas. She was married to Gaston Millspaugh. They had two sons, Dick (b. 10/29/1884) and Leigh (b. 10/26/1889). She was an active member of her community, taking part in chuch activities, going to lectures, circuses, fairs, parades and parties among her friends.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of the diary of Nina Millspaugh. Entries include accounts of her chores and the day's events, as well as the weather. A selective transcript is available in the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged chronologically within a bound record book.
